Class RiderPostRequestActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback

    public class RiderPostRequestActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    The type Rider post request activity. Rider able to post a new request. Rider need to enter a starting point and a end point.
    See Also:
    MapsRiderActivity

      This method takes the results from the MapsRiderActivity and stores those results(Start and end points, their LatLng coordinates, distance from start and end points) in order to be added to the ride requests.

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                Intent data)
        This method takes the results from the MapsRiderActivity and stores those results(Start and end points, their LatLng coordinates, distance from start and end points) in order to be added to the ride requests. https://developer.android.com/training/basics/intents/result.html http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5195837/format-float-to-n-decimal-places Accessed on November 8, 2016
        Overrides:
        onActivityResult in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        requestCode - This parameter is the request code sent from startActivityForResult() which allows us to know where the result came from
        resultCode - This parameter is used to determine if the results returned are good for use
        data - This parameter holds the data gotten from MapsRiderActivity
        See Also:
        RideRequest, MapsRiderActivity
